body:
# Bars 
# By Dog Face Development


You pick a bar, the computer picks a bar and the person (or computer) to pick the last bar wins!  
Written in Python and run through the Python Module (IDLE). 

![Screenshot 1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/willtheorangeguy/Bars/master/Screenshot.JPG)


## Features
* A fun game to play against the computer.
* Helps children learn and use their problem solving skills and math skills.


## Purpose
The purpose of this game is to be a quick and easy game to play against the computer whenever you have spare time or are just looking for something to do.


## Contributors
* @willtheorangeguy - Main Code Manager and Repo Creator


## Installation
If you have any problems installing the software please contact us over at the [Issues page](https://github.com/Dog-Face-Development/Bars/issues)


### Through The Python Module
*	Download the Python module if you haven’t already: [Download Link](https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-352/), and install it,
*       Extract files from your GitHub Download,
*	Open the nim.py file in the Python Module (IDLE),
*	Select Run>Run Module, or press F5 in the Edit Window of IDLE,
*	And the app will open for you to use!


### Creating and Executable File Through cx_Freeze (Python 3.4 and lower and Windows Only)
*	Download cx_Freeze if you haven’t already: [Download Link](https://pypi.python.org/packages/b7/64/2e8bbd862e72253d0aee6e69a30e06af1baa11bcc96c1ffb2a4303fb6b23/cx_Freeze-4.3.4.win32-py3.4.exe#md5=bd087416c69ced533768a22e5d3414b8), and install it,
*	Extract the files from your GitHub download to this location on your computer: C:\Users\YOUR_USERNAME,
*	Open Command Prompt and type the following command:
```
Python setup.py bdist_msi,
```
*	Run the .msi file that the process creates in a dist sub-directory to create an executable,
*	Run the executable and the app will open for you to use!


## Game Play Instructions
The object of the game is to be the person to select the last group of bars.

To start the game, press the space bar after the game has loaded.

Then click the right most bar from the group of bars that you want to select. 

![Start the Game!](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/willtheorangeguy/Bars/master/Screenshot2.PNG)

Then wait for the computer to select some bars.

![Playing the Game!](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/willtheorangeguy/Bars/master/Screenshot%20-%20Playing.PNG)

Keep repeating the above two steps until you or the computer selects the last group of bars.
The person (or computer) to select the last group wins!

As you can see in the picture below, I lost!

![The End. (I Lost!)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/willtheorangeguy/Bars/master/Screenshot-%20End%20(Lost).PNG)


## Releases
The most recent stable version release is version 1.4. Version 1.4 added:
* Screenshots to the README
* Different fonts

The next release, version 1.5 I coming out soon with new bug fixes and features:
* Bug Fixes
* README and Website updates
* Easier difficulty (Could also be released in Version 2.0)
* (MAYBE) Difficulty settings (Could also be released in Version 2.0)

Sending in a [pull request](https://github.com/Dog-Face-Development/Bars/pulls) for new features you would like to implement and bugs that need fixing are always welcome. 
Creating a new [issue](https://github.com/Dog-Face-Development/Bars/issues) for a new feature or bug that needs fixing is welcome too.
Look to see your contributions in future updates.


## Bugs and Issues
Who like bugs in their software? (We don't think anybody does! :-)) That's why we try hard to make sure that there are no bugs in our software, but sometimes a few slip though the system. If you have found any feel free to let us know on the [Issues page](https://github.com/Dog-Face-Development/Bars/issues)! We will try to have those bugs fixed as soon as possible. 
**Note:** Please check the known issues list below before posting an issue to see if your issue us already on the list:
* There are currently no know issues! Don't be afraid to submit one if you find one.
